TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit AnnotationHelper extends System.Object
public ref class AnnotationHelper abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides utility methods and commands to create and delete highlight, ink sticky note, and text sticky note annotations.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ClearHighlightsForSelection (System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service);
.method public static hidebysig void ClearHighlightsForSelection(class System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service) cil managed
Public Shared Sub ClearHighlightsForSelection (service As AnnotationService)
public: static void ClearHighlightsForSelection(System::Windows::Annotations::AnnotationService ^ service);
static member ClearHighlightsForSelection : System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService -> unit

Docs.param: The annotation service from which to remove highlight annotations.
Docs.summary: Clears all highlight annotations from the current selection of the viewer control associated with the given .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the current viewer selection is zero length or does not overlap any annotation highlights, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationHelper.ClearHighlightsForSelection%2A> performs no operation.
If the current viewer selection overlaps a highlight only partially, only the portion of the selection that overlaps is cleared and the unselected portion of the annotation highlight remains.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation CreateHighlightForSelection (System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service, string author, System.Windows.Media.Brush highlightBrush);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation CreateHighlightForSelection(class System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service, string author, class System.Windows.Media.Brush highlightBrush) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateHighlightForSelection (service As AnnotationService, author As String, highlightBrush As Brush) As Annotation

public: static System::Windows::Annotations::Annotation ^ CreateHighlightForSelection(System::Windows::Annotations::AnnotationService ^ service, System::String ^ author, System::Windows::Media::Brush ^ highlightBrush);
static member CreateHighlightForSelection : System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService * string * System.Windows.Media.Brush -> System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation

Docs.param: The annotation service to use to create the highlight annotation.
The brush to use to draw the highlight over the selected content.
Docs.summary: Creates a highlight annotation on the current selection of the viewer control associated with the specified .
Docs.returns: The highlight annotation; or , if there is no selected content to highlight.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The highlight annotation is anchored to the content defined by the current selection of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> control specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
If there is no selected content (the selection length is zero length), no annotation is created and an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown.
`author` can be specified as `null` in which case no author is defined.
If `highlightBrush` is `null`, the default highlight brush of the given annotation `service` is used.
The given annotation `service` must be enabled by means of a call to <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.Enable%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> prior to calling <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationHelper.CreateHighlightForSelection%2A>.

Docs.exception:
is not enabled.
-or-
in not a .
The viewer control contains no content selection.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation CreateInkStickyNoteForSelection (System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service, string author);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation CreateInkStickyNoteForSelection(class System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service, string author) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateInkStickyNoteForSelection (service As AnnotationService, author As String) As Annotation
public: static System::Windows::Annotations::Annotation ^ CreateInkStickyNoteForSelection(System::Windows::Annotations::AnnotationService ^ service, System::String ^ author);
static member CreateInkStickyNoteForSelection : System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService * string -> System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation

Docs.param: The annotation service to use to create the ink sticky note annotation.
Docs.summary: Creates an ink sticky note annotation on the current selection of the viewer control associated with the specified .
Docs.returns: The ink sticky note annotation; or , if there is no selected content to annotate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ink sticky note annotation is anchored to the content defined by the current selection of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> control specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
If there is no user-selected content (the selection length is zero length), no annotation is created and an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown.
`author` can be specified as `null` in which case no author is defined.
The given annotation `service` must be enabled by means of a call to <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.Enable%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> prior to calling <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationHelper.CreateInkStickyNoteForSelection%2A>.

Docs.exception: The viewer control contains no content selection.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation CreateTextStickyNoteForSelection (System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service, string author);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation CreateTextStickyNoteForSelection(class System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service, string author) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateTextStickyNoteForSelection (service As AnnotationService, author As String) As Annotation
public: static System::Windows::Annotations::Annotation ^ CreateTextStickyNoteForSelection(System::Windows::Annotations::AnnotationService ^ service, System::String ^ author);
static member CreateTextStickyNoteForSelection : System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService * string -> System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation

Docs.param: The annotation service to use to create the text sticky note annotation.
Docs.summary: Creates a text sticky note annotation on the current selection of the viewer control associated with the specified .
Docs.returns: The text sticky note annotation; or , if there is no selected content to annotate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The text sticky note annotation is anchored to the content defined by the current selection of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer>, or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> control specified to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
If there is no user-selected content (the selection length is zero length), no annotation is created and an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> is thrown.
`author` can be specified as `null` in which case no author is defined.
The given annotation `service` must be enabled by means of a call to <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.Enable%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> prior to calling <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationHelper.CreateTextStickyNoteForSelection%2A>.

Docs.exception: The viewer control contains no content selection.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DeleteInkStickyNotesForSelection (System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service);
.method public static hidebysig void DeleteInkStickyNotesForSelection(class System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service) cil managed
Public Shared Sub DeleteInkStickyNotesForSelection (service As AnnotationService)
public: static void DeleteInkStickyNotesForSelection(System::Windows::Annotations::AnnotationService ^ service);
static member DeleteInkStickyNotesForSelection : System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService -> unit

Docs.param: The annotation service from which to delete ink sticky note annotations.
Docs.summary: Deletes ink sticky note annotations that are wholly contained within the current selection of the viewer control associated with the given .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the viewer control associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.%23ctor%2A> contains no user selection or the user selection does not wholly contain any ink sticky note annotations, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationHelper.DeleteInkStickyNotesForSelection%2A> performs no operation.
The given annotation `service` must be enabled by means of a call to <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.Enable%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> prior to calling <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationHelper.DeleteInkStickyNotesForSelection%2A>.

static member DeleteTextStickyNotesForSelection : System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService -> unit

Docs.param: The annotation service from which to delete text sticky note annotations.
Docs.summary: Deletes text sticky note annotations that are wholly contained within the current selection of the viewer control associated with the given .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the viewer control associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.%23ctor%2A> contains no user selection or the user selection does not wholly contain any text sticky note annotations, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationHelper.DeleteTextStickyNotesForSelection%2A> performs no operation.
The given annotation `service` must be enabled by means of a call to <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService.Enable%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> prior to calling <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationHelper.DeleteTextStickyNotesForSelection%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Annotations.IAnchorInfo GetAnchorInfo (System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service, System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation annotation);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Annotations.IAnchorInfo GetAnchorInfo(class System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService service, class System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation annotation) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetAnchorInfo (service As AnnotationService, annotation As Annotation) As IAnchorInfo
public: static System::Windows::Annotations::IAnchorInfo ^ GetAnchorInfo(System::Windows::Annotations::AnnotationService ^ service, System::Windows::Annotations::Annotation ^ annotation);
static member GetAnchorInfo : System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationService * System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation -> System.Windows.Annotations.IAnchorInfo

Docs.param: The annotation service to use for this operation.
The annotation to get anchoring information for.
Docs.summary: Returns an object that provides anchoring information, such as the anchor location, about the specified annotation.
Docs.returns: An object that provides anchoring information about the specified annotation, or if it cannot be resolved.

remarks.format:
## Examples Consider a simple document reader application that has a comments pane. The comments pane might be a list box that displays the text from a list of annotations that are anchored to a document. If the user selects an item in the list box, then the application brings into view the paragraph in the document that the corresponding annotation object is anchored to.
The following example demonstrates how to implement the event handler of such a list box that serves as the comments pane.
[!code-csharp[FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer#Handler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#handler)] [!code-vb[FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer#Handler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#handler)]
